subject: Re: [junit] Timing individual Test Methods, and Test Classes
msgSnippet: Kamal, A while back I needed the same information so I wrote an aspect using AspectJ. The code, configuration and environment setup are all documents here:
messageBody:
Kamal,

A while back I needed the same information so I wrote an aspect using AspectJ. The code, configuration and environment setup are all documents here: http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/JUnit+Test+Method+Timings

There are several ways to make this work with your code:
You can use AJDT (and eclipse plug-in)
You can write an ant script to compile your code.
You can enable runtime weaving.
The instructions I've included above assume option #3. I recommend either option #3 or #1 with #1 being, I believe, the lightest weight solution.

I'll be updating this page after I send this email to make the instructions a bit more cut and dry.

Brett

Tutorials and Articles
http://schuchert.wikispaces.com/

Thanks,
